DataElement.preferredName: Primary Tumor Excision Lesion Complete Excision Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify the complete removal or excision by surgical means of the primary tumor, so that surgical margins are free of gross and microscopic tumor. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Complete removal or excision by surgical means of the primary tumor, so that surgical margins are free of gross and microscopic tumor. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: (ree-SEK-shun) Removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
